title: spack unable to resume interrupted trilinos build
body:
@BarrySmith @tgamblin

spack thinks trilinos is already installed.  But if I try to uninstall it...
```
amklinv@edison10:~/edison/spack/bin> ./spack uninstall trilinos
==> Error: trilinos does not match any installed packages.
==> Error: You can either:
    a) Use a more specific spec, or
    b) use spack uninstall -a to uninstall ALL matching specs.
```

Or if I do spack find...
```
amklinv@edison10:~/edison/spack/bin> ./spack find
==> 16 installed packages.
-- cray-CNL-ivybridge / gcc@6.1.0 -------------------------------
boost@1.63.0  cmake@3.7.1  hypre@develop    m4@1.4.17    metis@5.1.0  netcdf@4.4.1     openssl@1.0.2j  superlu-dist@develop
bzip2@1.0.6   glm@0.9.7.1  libsigsegv@2.10  matio@1.5.9  ncurses@6.0  openblas@0.2.19  parmetis@4.0.3  zlib@1.2.10
```

This wouldn't be a big deal for most packages, but trilinos is big and takes a while to install, so the chance of that getting interrupted is non-negligible.
